root_causes: Validation for each subquestion is too permissive: the script uses any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1,2) and any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2,1,2), which allows code 2 in the first subquestion and code 1 in the second subquestion. Expected subquestions have distinct valid codes (subquestion_1 valid code = 1; subquestion_2 valid code = 2).
instructions: Restrict validation to the exact valid code(s) for each subquestion. For example, replace any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1,2) with any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1) or (HidScn4Bn4COrder_1 = 1), and replace any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2,1,2) with any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2,2) or (HidScn4Bn4COrder_2 = 2).

Keep the isTest() entry condition as-is. After tightening the per-subquestion checks, the selection will correctly identify respondents who provided the expected codes for the appropriate subquestions.

root_causes: Validation for each subquestion is too permissive: the script uses any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1,2) and any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2,1,2), which allows the wrong answer code to be accepted for each subquestion. Expected subquestions have distinct valid codes (subquestion_1 valid code = 1; subquestion_2 valid code = 2).
instructions: Restrict validation to the exact valid code(s) for each subquestion. Replace any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1,2) with any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1) or (HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1 = 1), and replace any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2,1,2) with any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2,2) or (HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2 = 2).
Keep the isTest() entry condition. After tightening the per-subquestion checks, the selection will correctly identify respondents who provided the expected codes for each subquestion.
